intro: Myrmeconauclea stipulacea, commonly known as the stipulate myrmecodia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its unique, tuberous root system and its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. Myrmeconauclea stipulacea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
